page.title: 03Deliveries In Greenhill
page.content: Greenhill is a small hamlet on high ground situated between Purton and Wootton Bassett off the B4041. At the present time (August 1985) there are 81 people living in the hamlet. Despite being rather a long way from the main road and bus route there is a good delivery service by the local tradesmen. The milkman calls 5 days a week. The butcher and baker call 3 times a week. The postman calls both for delivery and collection every day except Sunday. The inhabitants also get a daily delivery of newspapers. In an area like this, where there are no shops, the regular visits of tradespeople are of immense value. In Greenhill 28 households own at least one car and the nearest shops are in Purton and Wootton Bassett.
